text: Onold (died between 1180 and 1187) - the third bishop of Kujawy.ks. dr Jan Fijałek Ustalenie chronologii biskupów włocławskich, Kraków 1894, s. 11-12 According to tradition (unconfirmed by documents), it was precisely in his time that the seat of the diocese of Kujawy moved from Kruszwica to Włocławek.Fr. Dr Jan Fijałek. Establishing the chronology of Włocławek bishops, (Kraków 1894). It is not known when Onold took over the rule in the Włocławek diocese. He is documented for the first time as a bishopric on 21 May 1161. While his predecessor Warner is known only from the Papal Bull of Eugene III from April 1148. It is also unknown how long Onold held his office. He certainly lived in 1180, when he took part in the synagogue in Łęczyca, where the first immunities for the clergy were passed. His successor Stefan has been documented since 1187. ==References== Category:Bishops of Poznań Category:Year of birth unknown Category:14th-century births Category:1346 deaths Category:14th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Medieval Polish nobility Category:14th-century Polish people
title: Onold
